pageContext.claim: “Every single state will be able to test more people per capita in May alone than South Korea has tested in four months since the outbreak began.”
pageContext.analysis: There's a reason South Korea no longer needs to test at high levels and wound up with lower per capita testing rates than some U.S. states are now seeing. South Korea implemented lockdown measures, contact tracing and mass testing weeks earlier than the United States and many other countries, which siginificantly mitigated and slowed the spread of the coronavirus inside its borders. The country is seen as a model in terms of "flattening the curve," though later in the year, it had a spike in cases.
